result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roderick L Schier

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Indigency hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 7, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on January 12, 2023 at 01:40 pm.

No contact with victim(s): E.T. or T.G.S.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve property from the residence (Marathon County Sheriff's Department).  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

ADDRESS INFO for Roderick L Schier
Current: 204375 State Highway 97, Marshfield, WI 54449   (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 204375 State Highway 13, Marshfield, WI 54449

Case Called: 2:22 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence in person.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Jack Mathie in person.
VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY.

BOND: 
$500.00 Signature Bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): E.T. or T.G.S. 
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence- Marathon County Sheriff's Department. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
PTC with JA 12/07/22 @ 9:10 am
JPTC/TPD 01/12/23 @ 1:40 pm
IH 11/07/22 @ 9:30 am in Branch 1
